record.name: accountNotFound
record.description: The accountId does not correspond to a valid account.

record.name: accountNotSupportedByMethod
record.description: The accountId given corresponds to a valid account, but the account does not support this method or data type.

record.name: accountReadOnly
record.description: This method modifies state, but the account is read-only (as returned on the corresponding Account object in the JMAP Session resource).

record.name: anchorNotFound
record.description: An anchor argument was supplied, but it cannot be found in the results of the query.

record.name: alreadyExists
record.description: The server forbids duplicates, and the record already exists in the target account. An existingId property of type Id MUST be included on the SetError object with the id of the existing record.

record.name: cannotCalculateChanges
record.description: The server cannot calculate the changes from the state string given by the client.

record.name: forbidden
record.description: The action would violate an ACL or other permissions policy.

record.name: fromAccountNotFound
record.description: The fromAccountId does not correspond to a valid account.

record.name: fromAccountNotSupportedByMethod
record.description: The fromAccountId given corresponds to a valid account, but the account does not support this data type.

record.name: invalidArguments
record.description: One of the arguments is of the wrong type or otherwise invalid, or a required argument is missing.

record.name: invalidPatch
record.description: The PatchObject given to update the record was not a valid patch.

record.name: invalidProperties
record.description: The record given is invalid.

record.name: notFound
record.description: The id given cannot be found.

record.name: notJSON
record.description: The content type of the request was not application/json, or the request did not parse as I-JSON.

record.name: notRequest
record.description: The request parsed as JSON but did not match the type signature of the Request object.

record.name: overQuota
record.description: The create would exceed a server-defined limit on the number or total size of objects of this type.

record.name: rateLimit
record.description: Too many objects of this type have been created recently, and a server-defined rate limit has been reached. It may work if tried again later.

record.name: requestTooLarge
record.description: The total number of actions exceeds the maximum number the server is willing to process in a single method call.

record.name: invalidResultReference
record.description: The method used a result reference for one of its arguments, but this failed to resolve.

record.name: serverFail
record.description: An unexpected or unknown error occurred during the processing of the call. The method call made no changes to the server's state.

record.name: serverPartialFail
record.description: Some, but not all, expected changes described by the method occurred. The client MUST resynchronise impacted data to determine the server state.

record.name: serverUnavailable
record.description: Some internal server resource was temporarily unavailable. Attempting the same operation later (perhaps after a backoff with a random factor) may succeed.

record.name: singleton
record.description: This is a singleton type, so you cannot create another one or destroy the existing one.

record.name: stateMismatch
record.description: An ifInState argument was supplied, and it does not match the current state.

record.name: tooLarge
record.description: The action would result in an object that exceeds a server-defined limit for the maximum size of a single object of this type.

record.name: tooManyChanges
record.description: There are more changes than the client's maxChanges argument.

record.name: unknownCapability
record.description: The client included a capability in the "using" property of the request that the server does not support.

record.name: unknownMethod
record.description: The server does not recognise this method name.

record.name: unsupportedFilter
record.description: The filter is syntactically valid, but the server cannot process it.

record.name: unsupportedSort
record.description: The sort is syntactically valid but includes a property the server does not support sorting on or a collation method it does not recognise.

record.name: willDestroy
record.description: The client requested an object be both updated and destroyed in the same /set request, and the server has decided to therefore ignore the update.

record.name: mailboxHasChild
record.description: The Mailbox still has at least one child Mailbox. The client MUST remove these before it can delete the parent Mailbox.

record.name: mailboxHasEmail
record.description: The Mailbox has at least one message assigned to it, and the onDestroyRemoveEmails argument was false.

record.name: blobNotFound
record.description: At least one blob id referenced in the object doesn't exist.

record.name: tooManyKeywords
record.description: The change to the Email's keywords would exceed a server-defined maximum.

record.name: tooManyMailboxes
record.description: The change to the set of Mailboxes that this Email is in would exceed a server-defined maximum.

record.name: invalidEmail
record.description: The Email to be sent is invalid in some way.

record.name: tooManyRecipients
record.description: The envelope (supplied or generated) has more recipients than the server allows.

record.name: noRecipients
record.description: The envelope (supplied or generated) does not have any rcptTo email addresses.

record.name: invalidRecipients
record.description: The rcptTo property of the envelope (supplied or generated) contains at least one rcptTo value that is not a valid email address for sending to.

record.name: forbiddenMailFrom
record.description: The server does not permit the user to send a message with this envelope From address .

record.name: forbiddenFrom
record.description: The server does not permit the user to send a message with the From header field of the message to be sent.

record.name: forbiddenToSend
record.description: The user does not have permission to send at all right now.

record.name: mdnAlreadySent
record.description: The message has the "$mdnsent" keyword already set. The client MUST NOT try again to send an MDN for this message.
